subject: Nutrition
title: Sleep and Sports Nutrition
description: A quick win: understand Sleep and Sports Nutrition.

hook.text: Sleep deprivation raises hunger hormones by 15% and cuts muscle recovery by 40%. Diet and sleep connect.

buildup.text: Growth hormone for muscle repair is released primarily during deep sleep cycles overnight.

discovery.text: Tart cherry juice improves sleep quality in athletes because it contains natural melatonin.

twist.text: Caffeine 6 hours before bed reduces deep sleep by 20%â€”undermining the recovery it was supposed to help.

climax.text: Sports nutrition doesn't stop at food. Sleep is when the body actually uses the nutrients you ate.

punchline.text: Recovery happens during sleep, not just during meals.
